long I there lie-PSTII1SG. mother-PX1SG work-ELA return-PSTII3SG and see-PSTII3SG, EVI-
particle: pen front-INESS I lie-PRES1SG. quickly splash-PSTII3SG and house bring-PSTII3SG. but

tier.item: ta uk dor2n k2k-ku korkan porjos ulo val. udmurtjosle l´ukik2sa, soos2n ter2tek,
oc´c´2 uk dor2 koskil´l´am. nos b2des gurt k2l2mte i, lea. o2 ik b2ril´l´am-a,

'This ravine near-INESS two-three house Mari-PL life-PRES3SG EXIST-PAST. Udmurt-PL-ABL
seperate-CONV they-INESS fit-CONV-NEG, there-ILL ravine near-ILL leave-PSTII3PL. but all
village stay-PSTII3SG-NEG so, build-CONV. So end-PSTII3PL-QUESTPART, leave- PSTII3PL-
QUESTPART, NEGVER-PRES-1SG know-IMP. house-PX3PL stay-PSTII3PL be-PSTII3SG and, that
_why vuzkorkauk call-PSTII3PL.
'Nearby the ravine, there (once) lived some Maris (lit. two-three houses full of Maris).
They separated from the Udmurts, because they did not get along and left to this
ravine. Seemingly, they did not found a village there. I don't know whether they died
or whether they left. Their houses were left and that's why this place is called
vuzkorkauk (the ravine of old houses).'
(40) ta uk dor2n k2k-ku korkan porjos ulo val. udmurtjosle l´ukik2sa, soos2n ter2tek,
oc´c´2 uk dor2 koskil´l´am. nos b2des gurt k2l2mte i, lea. o2 ik b2ril´l´am-a,
koskil´l´am-a, uk to·k2 i. korkoss2 k2lem v2lem no, soini vuzkorkauk suil´l´am.

seperate-CONV they-INESS fit-CONV-NEG, there-ILL ravine near-ILL leave-PSTII3PL. but all
village stay-PSTII3SG-NEG so, build-CONV. So end-PSTII3PL-QUESTPART, leave- PSTII3PL-
QUESTPART, NEGVER-PRES-1SG know-IMP. house-PX3PL stay-PSTII3PL be-PSTII3SG and, that
_why vuzkorkauk call-PSTII3PL.
'Nearby the ravine, there (once) lived some Maris (lit. two-three houses full of Maris).
They separated from the Udmurts, because they did not get along and left to this
ravine. Seemingly, they did not found a village there. I don't know whether they died
or whether they left. Their houses were left and that's why this place is called
vuzkorkauk (the ravine of old houses).'

ta uk dor2n k2k-ku korkan porjos ulo val. udmurtjosle l´ukik2sa, soos2n ter2tek, oc´c´2 uk dor2 koskil´l´am. nos b2des gurt k2l2mte i, lea. o2 ik b2ril´l´am-a, koskil´l´am-a, uk to·k2 i. korkoss2 k2lem v2lem no, soini vuzkorkauk suil´l´am.

'This ravine near-INESS two-three house Mari-PL life-PRES3SG EXIST-PAST.Udmurt-PL-ABL seperate-CONV they-INESS fit-CONV-NEG, there-ILL ravine near-ILL leave-PSTII3PL.but all village stay-PSTII3SG-NEG so, build-CONV.So end-PSTII3PL-QUESTPART, leave-PSTII3PL- QUESTPART, NEGVER-PRES-1SG know-IMP.house-PX3PL stay-PSTII3PL be-PSTII3SG and, that _why vuzkorkauk call-PSTII3PL.

Nearby the ravine, there (once) lived some Maris (lit. two-three houses full of Maris). They separated from the Udmurts, because they did not get along and left to this ravine. Seemingly, they did not found a village there. I don't know whether they died or whether they left. Their houses were left and that's why this place is called vuzkorkauk (the ravine of old houses).
(41) núman húci ek ruwe ne
yesterday grandmother come eEVD COP
`Grandmother came yesterday.'
